reviews.review_msg: You're allowed a cheat cheat on his midterm and final. Assign - 20%, midterm - 30%, final - 50%. If you screw up your midterm, final can be worth 80%..... material is awfully dry. Final was harder than expected.

After a mind-bending lecture, a scared student asks: "Uh, will this be on the exam?" McNeney: "Oh no, you won't come across this until 3rd year." *_* I would rather eat glass than take a course with him again. Cold and boring and unnecessarily difficult.
Nice guy, boring class
Need a little sleep? Come to this class. Nice guy, dry personality & materia

If you do take a class with him, make sure you sit at the front of the class. He explains concepts very slowly, and guides you through each and every step.  Reading the textbook prior to lecture would make the lectures much less dry. Notes are unorganized, but the exams are really easy.

Best stat prof you'll ever meet at SFU. If you're looking into taking a Q course, STAT101 with Ian will be your best choice. Very helpful and clear on what he expects to be on his two midterms and finals. If you attend his class and ask for help when you're unsure, you'll guarantee to do well. Good luck.
Clear on notes, gives you notes in advance, always there to help, makes class interesting
super nice
very nice pro best ever

I went to class every saturday morning because Ian was such a great prof! He genuinely cares about his students and always makes time to help you through the course. Definitely recommend him. I would take more classes with him but I hate stats wish there were more profs like him.
Very nice guy. He is very helpful. The material is hard but if you study and pay attention you will do fine. Ian is extremely helpful and encourages students to come for extra help.
clear notes. nice teacher
nice prof. clear voice ,simple notes    really enjoyed

I am so confused by half these reviews I just recently had Dr. Yapa for stats and she was one of the kindest profs I have seen at SFU. Her lectures were short and we rarely had them throughout the week. Yes some of her lectures had issues but she was always willing to help fix those issues with students.

Do not listen to the comments about this teacher. This teacher shows you that you have to put in the effort in learning the material yourself. As long as you read the text book and do the practice questions, You will have fun and breeze through this course. She gives over 10 hours of Teacher assistance. Literally no other class does that.

She is the worst professor I have ever met. She spends a lot of time on cumbersome teaching forms instead of teaching content. Her lecture is terrible. Her explanation of knowledge points is very superficial and vague. However, her homework and exams are even worse. She wrote the questions herself, and the exam questions were often confused.

I'm taking her course online and it is just terrible. Sometimes it seems like she said to herself "how can I make this course as boring as possible for these kids". I wish I read these other comments about her before I signed up for her class because they are nothing but true and I would have never taken her course.

This seems to be a trend on this page, but truly Dr. Yapa is the worst professor I've ever had. Her lectures are dry/reading from the textbook and often just includes incomplete segments. Tests are incredibly disorganized, constant failures, and yet she does not seem to care at all. Student concerns are ignored or given non-answers.
Gaitri Yapa is not helping at all, if you end up choosing her, prepare to read the textbook by yourself. Don't watch her lecture, or you will get as angry as I am now.
I'm amaze at how SFU would hire a lecturer like this. Her slides were so disorganize and her videos are always cut off. Totally not up to standard

Gaitri is one of the worst profs I have ever had at SFU. She is disorganized, hard to reach, and seems to have no clue what is going on. Her lectures are a joke, and you will basically be teaching everything to yourself. She refuses to answer questions outside of canvas and if she does answer they are all vague replies. Avoid her at all costs
BAD PROF. Don't listen to her lecture. You can learn more from the textbook than the lecture.

Prof was extremely unhelpful and I basically self-taught myself everything through textbook slides and the textbook. if you can avoid taking stats with this prof I strongly recommend not taking it with her. A lot of the time it felt as if even she didn't know what she was talking about. Worst experience ever.

Can u imagine that? I got A in stat203 but Im not sure I can pass this course. This lecturer is sucks and I dont know why she didnt teach anything in lecture. Dont take any courses relate with this lecturer. Even its stat100, its still not a GPA booster

WORST prof ever!!! Never seen a professor like this so disorganized, confused and lost in her own words. I did STAT 100 with her, the course was quite easy but seeing her made me angry. She does not know what she is talking about. Better to study at home than go to her class.
Worst professor I have ever had. She is passionate about statistics but has no idea how to teach it. Would not have passed without the textbook. Do not recommend to anyone.
She puts up the powerpoint slide and lets us read it quietly while she is just walking around the class .

Had some issues with this prof. Extremely unorganized. Attending class was not helpful what so ever. The lectures and slides were not useful and common sense. My iclicker did not work the entire semester and it didnt change my grade. Approachable but not helpful as she told me to discuss with classmates. Hardly answers emails. Do not recommend.

FOR STAT 270: Make sure to read the textbook before attending the lectures because she expects you to already know the material hence the "random" iclickers. The iclickers is for participation and it really helps you review the material.
She never knew the answers to her own questions or questions from the textbook but she expects you to know the answer. You're basically teaching yourself in this class.
Prof is most BORING prof ever. She talks in monotone voice the whole lecture. Material in class very easy, but she makes it very easy to fall behind. Definitely do not recommend.

this course was not that great. The material isn't too hard, but its tough to sit in and listen in on lecture. 90% of the class is gone anyways and all she ever does is read off the slide. If you put in effort to read the text and understand the material you will do well, otherwise, slacking and passing is still an option. (not exactly recommended)

Ridiculously hard to understand. She lacks the vocabulary to teach this course. Her availability is limited and she simply doesn't care to reason or answer many questions (she simply gives you a vague statement of something she has already said). It's no surprise that only 1/8 of our class ever shows up.
I failed the midterm, but i got c+ on the final...his final is easy
Never take a course with him. He is insanely difficult and teaches you nothing. Assignments have nothing to do with anything. Please take my advice and avoid him.

When he teaches the course, it is a self taught course. If you are not good at math avoid him. He is easily one of the worse actual teachers I have had in three years. Half the class failed the midterm to boot.

He's a really nice person in general, but his class is super boring. Assignments are totally different from the midterm. Only up side was the midterm and final was open book. Not a class to take unless you're actually interested in statistics

Avoid his class as possible as you can.His midterm is very difficult and half a class failed the exam!Also,plenty of assignments to do...but they are useless for the exam...All in all,don't choose his class...Although he looks very nice...

He does seem to be really enthusiastic about Stats and tries his hardest to get the class involved, but his teaching style isn't great and his slides are USELESS!! Half the class failed the midterm, and attendance became minimal. Overall a nice guy but would avoid taking a stats class with him if you can, especially if stats isn't really your thing

Overall I think Perera is a great Teacher, excellent notes and assignments explaining the concepts properly if you take your time to actually study them. Only downside is the need to buy SPSS and learning how to use it can be quite tricky. A majority of the time spent on assignment was probably learning how to use the program. Would recommend!

Good professor overall, the textbook itself is not that clear at explaining concepts but his lecture notes will clarify most of the information needed. Stats 101 requires the use of SPSS which most Stats TA's do not know how to use, so for assignments it would be wise to show to to class and listen to his SPSS demos. Solid class overall

Harha was awesome. He somehow made me look forward to 9am lectures and managed to make the dry content fairly interesting. His notes are straightforward and all of the midterms/finals are based on the assignment questions. Great prof overall, would definitely recommend taking class with him!

If you want to take a class where you have no communication with the prof who does not want to be contacted in anyway or care about your success; this is the class for you. Assignments were a breeze and midterm fairly easy. The 70% final is extremely difficult every third answer wrong he takes an additional mark off. Run from him and take in person

I have Stat 101 online but this course was easy and he provided us with the key point via Canvas, so you should just read books and his lectures. Recommend to have this course online with this prof to get basic knowledge about statistics and statistical procedures. By the way our TA was really great!
Not a very good professor. What are you doing teaching if you refuse to answer emails about what it's like to be a Statistics major?

This professor is so mean, if you have to talk to him. Normally you wouldn't in a distance ed class, but I had to write to him for an extension due to a specific situation. I provided the note too, and he did not care. I got an "extension" of a couple of hours and he said something really mean in his e-mail back. Avoid if possible!

I took it as distance education. I had never seen him in my whole semester and his TA is the only one that you will communicate with. TA was doing an awesome job for answering students' questions.  The mt was not so hard and the final was 60 m/c. He curved the whole class pretty fair. If u read the book regularly u will be fine.

Easy A+! Took it distance ed, so never got to see him - TA did everything. I guess he only designs the exams...but compared to the comments below, questions were super easy. Course content is easy enough to teach yourself, and grades are scaled pretty well. Great preparation course for BUEC 232/STAT 270. 2-sided cheatsheet allowed too =)

Hes a real gem. Hard to understand at times, but thats what makes it fun. He will seldom suddenly raise his voice and catch students falling asleep off guard hehe xd ill leave you with a quote: "there are lies, damned lies, and statistics"  8) PS exams are hard

Scott seems like a great guy and is pretty funny, however, his ability to teach a simple stat course isn't quite as funny. Notes were AWFUL and unhelpful and he never encouraged questions. If a question was asked about the concept, he would reply by saying "you have not been paying attention, and are falling behind!"

He is great at explaining concepts. You will have to attend every class. He teaches too man things that are not in the textbook, I don't think he understands that this class is intended for students that are not specializing in statistics.
my guy!

Scott was very intent on student's understanding of the big picture in statistics, and explained deep concepts well, allowing everyone to understand material. The difficulty for midterms  and final is fair, but midterms are mainly conceptual and final is very calculation based. Overall, a very good prof and he is pretty funny actually.

Okay professor, goes fast when teaching so I found it hard to learn. Had to read over the textbook and teach myself a lot of the concepts. Midterms and exam were unnecessarily hard/not enough time to write midterms. Everyone was still there at the end of the class of the midterms still frantically writing.

You really need to listen in lectures in his class, all of the material tested is gone over in lecture. If you pay attention in class and do the small amount of homework, you shouldn't need the textbook for anything other than light reference. Never miss a class even if you already know the material, Scott basically tells you what he'll test.

He's really a completely useless professor. Don't waste your time with him. You will learn 100 times better off YouTube as his teaching style is completely a pain to sit 50 minutes through. Take distance education for this class and avoid him at all costs.

I really enjoyed Scotts lectures. He makes sure to go through each important topic slowly and tries to ensure everyone understands during the lecture. He lets you know exactly what will be emphasized on the midterms, and always encourages students to make use of his office hours. Really funny and helpful prof.

I GOT AN A- AND I NEVER PAID ANY ATTENTION IN LEC!!! He says that he'll give pop quizzes but he never did...He's an okay prof...his assignments were pretty easy even though they were time consuming...I never understood his notes so I just read the text book instead

He is a good prof, concern about his students. He always says ' don't copy for something you don't know', and it is so true. Don't skip his class, because you will lose track with the materials. In the beginning the materials were ok, but at the end, they got so advanced..^^v

the most stupid guy i've seen in the school(not even qulify as a professor)!always give ppl an angry face,a harsh man...really unclear in english speaking,unorganized handout~hey,u guy'd better dont take his class!!

He is a good professor, but his quiz and exam quiet difficult even though I got an A- in his class. You have to understand his lecture well. He likes to give you a pop-quiz. When he said will have a quiz next class, he won't give you. You have no idea with the quiz. He have change quizes every semester, the passpaper is not helpful.

I cant believe they hire a guy like him to teach at university. extremely poor English language, a very unclear and unorganized professor( its even funny to me to call him a professor). He gives u very easy notes but exams are extremely difficult, they are not even covered in the text book. If u wanna ruin your gpa,then take a stat course with him.
I do believe Scott did his best to help our class!

he's nice. its true that he gives little examples with little use in lectures. he makes his exmaples confusing sometimes. but his review sessions are alot more helpful. i don't find the materials too hard. and of course midterms are easier than exams. doesn't just apply for this course and him. i truly feel that he wants to help us not fail us.
Scott is a very nice human but not a good teacher. He gives you examples which are already in the book, exams don't cover all the lectures, take this course with Robin Insley!

I think he is a very nice prof, he spent his own time to help students, it is not the problem that he was not trying, but the problem was not much ppl asked for help... I am not a smart person, but I studied, so I did okay in the course, no university course is "easy"... all I can say is... the tests expect a little bit too much for 100lv course

nice prof... he tries his best to help students... but can't teach the material very well... his examples in the lecture notes are not that great... material from MT1 and MT2 is relatively easy... it's harder each time... MT1>MT2>Final... 
 
 i wouldnt say he's a crappy prof cuz the other profs are not any better either...
No Comments

That's right. He really doesn't know how to teach. this's just first yr course but he made it so comfusing. Read the text book; don't need to come to class at all, because u get more comfused if u do.

This is the most lowest course of statistic but it seems like a second year course. Fairly and honestly not to be bias with Scott. His exam is really really hard even you study very hard,knowing the text book. You can not get any good grade, the exam question is harder than my friend second year statistic question and exam. The TA dun even know 2
He doesn't kno how to teach.....he assigned homework without teaching the related materials....

Goin to clas never helps in the asgments.. U hv to read the book by urself to do it. His notes are unorganized, very confusing, and more complicated than the materials in the textbook! However, u still HAVE to understand his notes in order to pass the exam even tho some of the notes are not related to the book! What a waste of $500! DonT recommend!

Totally don't know how to teach, he even give out assignment which he hasn't taught yet and expected you to know how to do it. He only explains simply materials and tests us extrem materials.His lectures are confusing and disorganzied, so expect to study on your own. He made me lost interested in stat....what a wonderful prof sfu has hired.

This prof does not know how to teach eventhough he has tried very hard to teach. He just make things even more complicated. I think there the connection between prof and TAs are very poor. The assignment material are not related to the lecture notes. Most of the assignment question have to learn by yourself from the text book. Not a good course.

Not a very interesting course, but it will be useful for business major students. His job is to tell you everything you need to know, not to make exams easy, because he is responsable for the money you paid for this course. His lecture is indeed not so clear, but only stupid students totally depend on lecture notes and ignore the text book.

he thinks teaching is his only job.he doesnt realize that if students fail,he fails,too.he always say'my job is blah blah...' even though he gives additional review class in order 2 study midterm. lecture is not clear,confused most of the time.i survived only bcoz half of da material was from gr12. dont expect him 2 b organized. get used of his mes
No Comments
The lecture was boring!! Exams are open book. Midterm is easy, but the final is damn hard!! The assignments are marked really low!!

She's very nice lady but awful prof. Her accent is so thick its absolutely impossible to follow what shes saying. When asked questions in class she responds with "Already explained the concept in previous lectures" and refuses to answer your question. Midterm wasnt that hard but assignments are very hrd. Awful prof.

She is the most disorganized professor I have ever had, especially the lecture slides. A lot of the questions on the assignments are the same as those of the 201 course, which is unfair under all circumstances and there is no excuse for this.

Although this course is easy because the entire class did bad (scaled), he is not responsible and never put this class as his priority by delaying everything. This STAT 101 class is much harder than BUEC 232 (which it shouldn't be).
